title: (x) Where the Sidewalk Ends book cover - Bookman Swash {Eric H}
content:
Anyone know what it is? I’m leaning toward custom, but am sure someone here can ID it.

 [‹ Very hard to find!! help me out :(](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709014549/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44200 "Go to previous forum topic") [San Serif Font Identification ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709014549/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44198 "Go to next forum topic")
author: timlahan

comments.content: Bookman medium swash italic. It might be a little customized on a few characters.

[Where the Sidewalk Ends](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709014549/http:/www.amazon.com/Where-Sidewalk-Ends-30th-Anniversary/dp/0060572345/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1207843655&sr=8-1)

That’s a link to the cover. Perhaps someone can chime in with more specific information on the cut.

I was actually reading this book to my wife’s stomach the other day.

Yeah, that’s the original [Bookman Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709014549/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085) as digitized by [Jason Walcott](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709014549/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Jason%252BWalcott). I would advise against using the ITC Bookman version as it is — well, you know — not beautiful.

\> _I was actually reading this book to my wife’s stomach the other day._

Why would anyone want to do that? Is there, perchance, a little Haguebaby on its way? :^P

<cite>Yeah, that’s the original Bookman Swash as digitized by Jason Walcott.</cite>

Ah, so it was the one at Veer. It was hassling me about a login to see the full char set, so I gave up early.

<cite>Is there, perchance, a little Haguebaby on its way?</cite>

There is a little Hague on the way! This June, actually.
Thanks, Yves. I’ll probably disappear from Typophile for a while this summer, but I’ll be back.

“There is a little Hague on the way! “  
Name could be Delft then? ;)

Cheers!

Ha! That didn’t make the short list, but we are thinking about buying something like [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709014549/http:/www.cafepress.com/buy/the+hague/-/pv_design_prod/p_2365863.129100136/pNo_129100136/id_19209896/fpt_/opt_/c_666/pg_2) for her.
